Entries.Entry: Hey. So, uh, have you heard anything from your dad lately?<wait>
Nope. Not a word. Not only did he up and leave Mom when she's so sick, he hasn't checked in even once. What a jerk, huh?<wait>
Talk about selfish, just up and leaving Mom when she's so sick!<wait>

Whoa, maybe retract those fangs a little, bud. He DID leave because he's looking for a cure for your mom, right?<wait><page> I don't think that's something a person would do unless they really cared about their family.<wait>
Well...yeah. Okay. Maybe.<wait>
And since he's not here, you've gotta step up and take care of both your mom and Popuri. Got it?<wait>
Well, duh. Of course I know that!<wait>
Good! On that note, what say we head home?<wait>
Yeah. And, um... Thanks, Karen.<wait>
Man, we sure played together a lot when we were kids. Do you remember, Karen?<wait>
Yup. We came up with all kinds of games to play. Kick the Can, Hide-and-Seek, Tag... You name it, we played it.<wait>
Haha! Yep! Heck, we even wrestled for a while, too.<wait><page> Don't think I ever beat you, either. You taught me at a very young age exactly what a mouthful of dirt tastes like.<wait>
H-Hey, I call shenanigans! I mean, it's not as if I was stomping around town like some muscle-bound freak.<wait>
Uh, yes you were? I clearly remember you flinging me around like a sack of turnips until I ran home crying.<wait>
Lies and slander! I don't remember ANY of that. Nope! Not at all! You're making it up just to mess with me, aren't you?<wait><page> That does it. I'm leaving!<wait>
Huh? What are you so mad for? Um, Karen? Kaaaren...! Come back!<wait>
Mmm, that was so yummy!<wait><page> Boy, Kai, everything you serve at your Cafe is so new and interesting! We don't have anything like it here in town.<wait>
How do you know so much about so many different places?<wait>

Dude, whaaat? Do I really seem like that much of a know-it-all?<wait><page> Haha! I mean, I travel a lot, so I pick up some stuff here and there, but there's still tons I don't know.<wait><page> That's why whenever I find a new dish or ingredient, I get my butt into the kitchen and run a little taste test.<wait><page> Not only do I like learning new stuff, but I wanna keep updating my menu with fresh and exotic dishes.<wait>
Wooow, really? That's so neat! You sure have a cool and mature way of thinking about stuff, Kai.<wait>
Naaah, I'm not all that. Y'see, just between you and me...<wait><page> I can't stand the cold. Like, seriously. That's why when it starts getting chilly here, I take off for somewhere warmer.<wait>
Avoiding the chill was the main reason I first started moving from place to place like I do. Kind of a dumb reason, right?<wait>
Hee hee! Kai, you're so silly!<wait>
Hey, Kai, I wonder... Do you think that if Mom had some of your cooking, she would feel better and happier?<wait>
I dunno! Wanna try it out? I can drop by your place and whip something up.<wait>
Ooh, will you really?<wait>
Yep, you bet! Just leave it to me!<wait>
Wow! Thanks so much, Kai!<wait>
Kai is really super-duper nice.<wait>
Okay, what would be best, I wonder...<wait>
I'm real glad your mom liked my cooking, Popuri.<wait>
Me too. Thanks so much for coming over and doing that, just like you said you would. It made me so happy!<wait>
No prob! Let's just hope it puts some pep in your mom's step.<wait>
Yeah!<wait>
Still...I'm really glad Rick wasn't home when you came over.<wait><page> If he found you here, I just know he'd be super-duper upset.<wait>
Good point.<wait>
Popuri! There you are!<wait>
What are you doing here, of all places? Kai, do me a favor and stop dragging my sister halfway across town.<wait>
Hey! Don't be rude! I was just talking with him. Is that a crime all of a sudden?<wait>
Anyway! You're supposed to be back at the store helping me. Let's go.<wait>
Hmph! If you're so worried about the store, you can take care of it all by yourself!<wait>
Wha-- Popuri, how could you say that?!<wait><page> This is YOUR fault, Kai. You're the one putting ideas in my sister's head. Knock it off!<wait>
Stop saying mean things about Kai! You don't get anything, Rick! You're being a horrible jerk!<wait>
Sis, why can't you--<wait>
Popuri, you should probably get going. Your mom's gonna worry, y'know?<wait>
Huh? Awww! But I... Okay. I guess you're right, Kai.<wait>
Let's go, Popuri. Kai, you stay away from my sister.<wait>
I'm sorry about this, Kai. I'll see you later, okay?<wait>
Sure. Get home safe, 'kay?<wait>

Dang, you heard all that? Sorry you had to sit through... whatever that was.<wait><page> Rick can be pretty annoying, eh? If he ever catches me chatting with Popuri, he comes charging up, mad as a bull. Ugh.<wait>
Oh...<wait>
Hey there, Cliff. How do you like it here?<wait>
Hey... Uh... No complaints.<wait>
Oh, that's good to hear!<wait>
Now that I think of it, we don't talk very often, do we?<wait>
I...guess we don't.<wait>
So, why'd you come to this town? To sightsee? Or for work? Ooh, or maybe--<wait>
Sorry, I... I don't wanna talk about it.<wait>
Oh... S-Sorry. I shouldn't have pried. Bad habit.<wait>
If you ever have a problem or need help with something, just let me know, okay?<wait><page> Well, I've still got work to do. Bye!<wait>
Oh... Um...<wait>
Yeees?<wait>
I, uh... Thanks, Ran.<wait>
You betcha!<wait>
...<wait>
Cliff, you ought to try speaking with the townspeople more. They are all very nice people, I assure you.<wait>
Yeah, but... It's awkward. And no one seems to actually enjoy talking with me.<wait>
You don't say? That's odd. You speak normally with me, and I enjoy our conversations well enough.<wait>
Because you're not like other people. Normal people, they... It's like...they perceive me differently, or something.<wait>
What is it that makes me "not like other people," I wonder...<wait>
Hello, Carter! Oh, and Cliff's with you too.<wait>
Hello, Ran.<wait>
...Hey.<wait>
You are something of a rare sight around the Church, Ran.<wait><page> What brings you here this afternoon?<wait>
Uh, you DID order delivery, didn't you? Otherwise, I'm here with somebody else's lunch.<wait>
Oh! I had completely forgotten. You are absolutely right. Thank you very much.<wait>
Huh, you're more of a space case than I thought, Carter.<wait><page> Well, here you are. Our special lunch, just for you!<wait>
By the way, what're YOU doing here at the Church, Cliff? Praying? Confessing? CLEANING?! I have this great wax--<wait>
Uh... Oh... Nothing, really.<wait>
Good grief.<wait>
Ran, I have a request for you.<wait>
Huh? What is it?<wait>
It's about Cliff. He is extremely shy, so he finds it difficult to speak with the townspeople.<wait>
W-Wait, Carter. What're you...?<wait>
I want to help you learn to get along with the townspeople, so I'm calling in some conversational muscle, as it were.<wait>
He's got a terminal case of shyness, huh? So THAT'S why...<wait>
Okay, I'll do it! I'll be his partner-in-cri--er, conversation! Just leave it to me!<wait>
What?! I-I didn't agree to--<wait>
Don't you worry! I'll rid you of that fear of strangers faster than I can scrub a stubborn stain outta linens!<wait>
All right, I still have some work to do at the Inn, so I'm heading back.<wait><page> Goodbye, Carter. See you at the Inn, Cliff.<wait>
Yes, of course. Goodbye, Ran.<wait>
...Right.<wait>
Carter... Why would you do that to me?<wait>
Rest easy, my child. Ran will be the perfect partner.<wait>
Something I can help you with, Marie?<wait>
The tool you repaired for me is so very easy to use, I wanted to come thank you again for your craftsmanship.<wait><page> I appreciate it very much.<wait>
Well, if you're that pleased by it, then I'm glad I repaired it for you.<wait><page> If you ever need my expertise again, come straight on over and see me, all right?<wait>
Yes! Thank you so much!<wait>
Ow!<wait>
...Don't mind me. It's nothing.<wait>
Oh no, you're bleeding.<wait>
Idiot. It's because you lost focus.<wait>
I said I'm fine.<wait>
No, you aren't!<wait>
Wait just a second. Um...<wait>
Oh, there it is. Give me your hand, Gray.<wait>
That should do it.<wait>
Th-Thanks.<wait>
Oh, no, it's my pleasure.<wait>
All right, I'll be going now. I hope to see you two at the Library someday.<wait>
We'll be sure to drop by sometime.<wait>
I promise to visit.<wait>
I'm glad. Goodbye for now.<wait>
Marie sure is nice.<wait>
Ugh... How many times have I told that boy to keep his eyes on his work?<wait>
Oh, hello there, Gray.<wait>
Hello.<wait>
Not many people in this town read books, so I hardly get any visitors. Thank you for stopping by.<wait>
Wonder why that is? It's not like you're hurting for interesting books here.<wait>
I'm glad to hear you think so. Oh, that's right...<wait>
To be honest, I'm writing a novel right now. Just as a hobby, mind you. But I haven't had many people read through it.<wait>
If it wouldn't be too much of a bother, would you mind reading it and telling me what you think?<wait>
YOU'RE writing a book? That's...that's amazing!<wait>
It's nothing that impressive, really. So, will you help me?<wait>
'Course. If you're all right with me reading it, I'd love to help.<wait>
Wonderful. I'll bring it to you later.<wait>
Right.<wait>
It's a little embarrassing to show it to other people, but I do think I need feedback if I want to refine it.<wait>
A novel written by you, huh? Wow. I can't wait to read it.<wait>
*sigh*<wait>
Are you fatigued?<wait>
No, I'm fine.<wait>
Please don't overwork yourself. If you were to collapse, there would be no shortage of townspeople in distress.<wait>
Oh, Doctor... Are you worried about me?<wait>
Naturally. No good physician would be pleased to see an increase in sick patients due to his staff's negligence.<wait>
*sigh* Oh, is that all?<wait>
What's the matter?<wait>
No, it's nothing.<wait>
Hm? Well, if you say so.<wait>
Is Elly truly all right? She seems more enervated than ever.<wait>
*sigh*<wait>
Grandma, how are you feeling?<wait>
Oh, much better now, dear.<wait>
Thank goodness.<wait>
It seems it was just a cold. Please keep warm and get plenty of rest.<wait>
Thank you, Doctor.<wait>
No thanks necessary. More importantly, how are your legs doing?<wait>
Hm... About the same as always, I'd say.<wait>
...<wait>
I apologize. If I were only more skilled...<wait>
You've nothing to trouble yourself over, Doctor.<wait>
Yes, she's right. You've already gone above and beyond for my grandmother!<wait>
I...appreciate that.<wait>
Doctor, it's about time to get back to the Clinic.<wait>
Right. Well then, take care.<wait>
Thank you, Doctor.<wait>
The word "grateful" hardly captures how I feel. Elly and Doctor have been so good to me.<wait>
I really look up to Doctor! And I'm sure Elly does, too.<wait>
